description.value:
Hispo is a massive dire wolf form, far larger and more powerful than any natural beast.

In Hispo form, a Garou moves with terrifying speed and strength, excelling at pursuit, battlefield mobility, and pack combat.

While less humanoid than Crinos, Hispo still invokes fear and awe, and its presence can trigger Delirium in mortal witnesses.

While in Hispo (Dire Wolf) form, you gain the following benefits and limitations.

Speed: 40 feet

Benefits:

• You have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are prone or restrained.

• Bite: 1d10 + Strength modifier (piercing).

• Claw: 1d6 + Strength modifier (slashing).

Limitations:

• You can’t speak.

• You can’t manipulate objects that require hands.
